# Data process

## Ireland

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description



| **Name** | `fl001_08`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Because of a physical or mental health problem, do you have difficulty Reaching or extending your arms above shoulder level?` |
| **Table name** | `TILDA-AMF-v16` |
| **Categories** |`0 = NOT Reaching or extending your arms above shoulder level`<br/>`1 = Reaching or extending your arms above shoulder level` |
| **Description** |  |



```{r assign w1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'TILDA_w1','TILDA.TILDA-AMF-v16', variables=list('fl001_08'), missings = TRUE)
TILDA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'TILDA_w1') %>% update_labelled()
```

```{r local w1, echo=F}
vari <- TILDA_w1$fl001_08
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = "fl001_08") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(TILDA_w1, aes(x=factor(fl001_08))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Difficulty Reaching or extending your arms above shoulder level") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 1`
* `1 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1, tidy=FALSE}

TILDA_ds_w1 <- TILDA_w1 %>%
  mutate(mob_arm = recode(replace_na(fl001_08, 999L), `0` = 1L, `1` = 0L)) %>%
  select(id, mob_arm)

```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vari <- TILDA_ds_w1$mob_arm
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(TILDA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(mob_arm))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories.


```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}

source("../../helpfunctions.r")

```




```{r summ, echo=F}

# All study waves and populations with abbreviated and descriptive names


tilda.cw <- list(w1 = c("w1","W1"), w2 = c("w2","W2"))

# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(tilda.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("TILDA_ds_",wname[1]))){wname = list(get(paste0("TILDA_ds_",wname[1])),wname[2])})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}

m.hds <- list()

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]])
  # Printing table of categories
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],sapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]])),caption=ds_label))
  # Printing table of trajectories
  f.dbb <- trajectories(lmlist[[2]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
  print(knitr::kable(f.dbb))
  # Saving tibbles
  savingRD(lmlist[[1]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
}



```
